status_message: HONORS: Sgt. Scott Lunger was honored with a 21-gun salute by Alameda County Sheriff's deputies, as Hayward's police chief presented folded American flags to his father and daughters. MORE VIDEO & PHOTOS HERE: http://abc7ne.ws/1JUiMN7

"Dear son… son, that is a word with many meaning. A friend, a buddy, someone to laugh with and play ball with, someone to encourage, comfort, protect, teach, and to enjoy. You, Scott, you were my son and you were my sunshine. You brightened my days." –  Sgt. Scott Lunger's father Paul Lunger said. http://abc7ne.ws/1MAjiGb

"Sgt. Scott Lunger was my mentor, my sergeant, my partner, and my brother. Sgt. Lunger had a saying, 'warriors work at night.' I can only hope I've done him proud." Hayward Officer Justin Green became emotional while talking about his fallen friend at today's memorial. http://abc7ne.ws/1MAjiGb

VIRAL VIDEO OF THE DAY: A toy train in space

A Santa Cruz father sent his son's toy train into space and now the video is a YouTube hit, with over 2.6 millions views in just one week. 

Ron Fugelseth attached his 4-year-old son Jayden's toy train to a weather balloon along with an HD camera and GPS. It traveled 18 miles up into the sky before the balloon burst and "Stanley" came tumbling down.  The toy was recovered 27 miles away in a corn field.  The entire journey was captured on video and edited by Fugelseth, who is the creative director for a Bay Area production company.

Watch the video here --> http://bit.ly/Ou6Vix

Plus, today at 3 on ABC7, father and son talk to Katie Couric about how they made the film and if it was hard to find Stanley after his trip back down to Earth.

The man known as the eye in the sky is calling it quits after 51 years on the radio.  KGO Radio's traffic guru Stan Burford is retiring.  He's one of the most familiar voices on Bay Area radio, and he gave traffic updates on the ABC7 morning news.

Stan began his career in 1961 at age 18. He joined KSFO as a traffic reporter in 1963 and has been with KGO since 1976.

The eye in the sky, a commuter's best friend, Stan did it better than anyone.

Click 'Like' to wish Stan a very happy retirement!

Can you spot the panda in this photo?

A birth watch has begun at the San Diego Zoo. The zoo's animal care staff is closely watching 20-year-old panda Bai Yun. An ultrasound shows the heartbeat of the fetus. The spine and a leg are also clearly visible.

If all goes well, this will be the sixth cub for Bai Yun and her mate Gao Gao. Bai Yun will be one of the oldest giant pandas known to give birth to a cub.

The Chick-fil-A controversy is turning the simple act of eating a chicken sandwich into a political statement. 

The mayors of Boston, Chicago, and San Francisco are among those saying the fast-food chain is not welcome in their cities because the company opposes same-sex marriage.

Chick-fil-A's president was recently quoted as saying, "I think we are inviting God's judgment on our nation when we shake our fist at him and say we know better than you as to what constitutes a marriage."

What do you think? Should cities be able to ban a company because of political beliefs?

Story --> http://bit.ly/LWGZVD

COLORADO SHOOTING UPDATE: A young couple who'd recently moved from New Mexico and were attending the Aurora, Colo., midnight screening of "The Dark Knight Rises" with their children said they had planned to sit in the front row by the exit in which a gunman entered and allegedly killed at least 12 people.

"Where the gunman came in, we were going to sit right there," 25-year-old Jamie Rohrs told ABC News today. "God was definitely with us and watching over us. I just thank God we sat where we did and showed up late."

BREAKING: Apple's China contractor comes under fire in independent labor group's audit.

Foxconn, the contractor that makes the Apple iPhone and iPad in China, worked employees in excess of 60 hours a week and more than seven days in a row without time off. The legal limit on work hours in China is 49 hours, including overtime. Those details and more were released this afternoon by the Fair Labor Association (FLA) based in Washington, D.C., of which Apple is a member. 

Story from ABC7's David Louie --> http://bit.ly/Hoxjp4

We'll have more on this developing story tonight on ABC7 News at 4 and 6.

The Yahoo! billboard along Hwy 101 in San Francisco is coming down. The sign went up during the first dot-com boom. Yahoo! isn't saying why it's being replaced, only that the space will be available starting next month. Click 'Like' if you considered the sign an icon/landmark.

In order to circumvent an order by the chancellor that forbade the pitching of camping tents on the grounds of Sproul Hall, Occupy Cal protesters floated their tents with balloons above the grounds of UC Berkeley on Thursday.
Ever wonder what happens to all those leftover Halloween pumpkins? Turns out elephants have quite the sweet tooth. Click 'Like' if this is the cutest thing you've seen all day!
Protesters are sitting on the ground inside the Bank of America branch and have even set up a tent inside. (There are also about a dozen police officers inside the branch.)
After an overwhelming vote by the Occupy Cal general assembly, tents are going back up in Sproul Plaza at UC Berkeley.

Oakland police officers are going from tent to tent issuing cease and desist notices to Occupy campers at Frank Ogawa Plaza. Citing several city ordinances, the notice calls on the Occupy protesters to immediately pack up their camp and leave.
BREAKING NEWS: There's a gas leak at Market and Beale streets in San Francisco. People are being told to shelter in place and avoid the area. A construction crew hit a gas main.

After police clashed with Occupy Cal protesters yesterday over people putting up tents in Sproul Plaza, today several tents have sprung up as police stand by and watch. What do you think about how the UC Berkeley officials and police are handling the situation?

If you were anywhere near South Africa this week and you looked up in the sky, you might have seen a rhinoceros dangling from a helicopter by its ankles. Nineteen of the rhinos were moved by helicopter from one part of the state to the other in order to combat poaching. The full story is on ABC7NEWS.COM.

ABC7's Laura Anthony is at the Oakland city council press conference, where four members of the city council are asking for the removal of "Occupy Oakland." In this photo, members of the Occupy movement are shouting down city council members.

Occupy San Jose demonstrator Sean O'Kelly is protesting from the top of a 60 foot wall outside SJ City Hall.  Police say they won't try to move him in case he falls. Is that the right decision or should they be making an effort to get him down?
The City of Oakland has ordered 'occupy' demonstrators at Frank Ogawa Plaza to pack it up and go home. If you were a protester, would you leave?

In this Associated Press photo, Mohammed al-Babi holds a golden pistol that once belonged to Moammar Gadhafi, who was killed earlier today after being discovered in a sewage pipe. What should happen to this gun?

status_message: DEVELOPING: The last rescue worker just surfaced from the San Jose Mine in Chile after all 33 men were brought to the surface safely.

shot to death two animals, all officers will now receive training in
animal behavior.
BREAKING: The last of the Chilean miners has been raised from deep beneath the earth. All 33 men have now beendelivered from the longest underground entrapment in history.
link_name: Last trapped Chilean miner rescued; ordeal ends

status_message: As night fell, 29 of the 33 miners, including the weakest and sickest, had been pulled to freedom, and officials appeared on track to pull up the last miner well before midnight (11 p.m. EDT).

status_message:

and watched by a captivated world.
link_name: Chile joyous at clockwork-like rescue of mines

status_message: Bay Area Red Cross posted the following on Facebook: The American Red Cross Bay Area Chapter disaster action team is on the scene in San Bruno responding to a fire that has engulfed dozens of homes. We have an evacuation center set up at the Bayhill Shopping Center in San Bruno and approximately 100 individuals are currently in a shelter at the Veterans Memorial Recreation Center in San Bruno.

It is believed that a 24-inch PG&E high-pressure gas line is the source of the explosion and fire. The Office of Emegency Services is giving the central location of the incident as Clairmont and Glenview drives.The San Mateo County Sheriff has activated the reverse-911 system to alert people in a three-quarter mile radius of a voluntary evacuation.
An emergency hotline has been set up for shelter information in the area: 650.616.7180

UPDATE: There is a PG&E high-pressure gas line in the area. It is unknown if it is related to the fire.  There are reports of multiple evacuations.  All the latest on this story will be posted throughout the night at the link below.  We'll continue to bring you major development on Facebook and Twitter as well.  Our live stream continues at the link below as well.
link_name: Multiple homes on fire after San Bruno explosion
